snippet: Secretary General Ban Ki-moon said he supported demands for an inquiry into whether the attack, which killed at least 140 people, was a war crime....

byline.original: By NICK CUMMING-BRUCE and ERIC SCHMITT
byline.contributor: Nick Cumming-Bruce reported from Geneva, and Eric Schmitt from Washington. Thomas Erdbrink contributed reporting from Tehran.

lead_paragraph: Secretary General Ban Ki-moon said he supported demands for an inquiry into whether the attack, which killed at least 140 people, was a war crime.

headline.main: U.N. Chief Condemns Airstrike on Yemeni Funeral and Dismisses Saudi Denials
headline.print_headline: U.N. Chief Condemns Yemen Strike Tied to Saudis
